info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 9:37AM CDT until June 8 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Bird Creek near Owasso-Mingo affecting Tulsa County.
Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Delaware and Cherokee Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Bird Creek near Owasso-Mingo.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, faster flows are expected along the river but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river and near Mohawk Park should continue to monitor later forecasts.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet tomorrow evening. This forecast includes rain that fell this morning and forecast rainfall for another thunderstorm complex that is expected late tonight. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
